longDescription: The fortified home of the Aesir gods, connected to Midgard by the rainbow bridge Bifrost. A realm of golden halls and divine power at the top of Yggdrasil. Asgard is the mightiest of the Nine Realms, home to the Aesir gods and their magnificent halls. Each major god has their own hall - Odin's Valhalla, Thor's Bilskirnir, Freyja's Folkvangr, and many others. The realm is surrounded by a great wall built by a giant (with Loki's interference preventing its completion).

description:
Explore temples, mountains, groves, and holy sites that have served as gateways between the human and divine realms
                across cultures and millennia. From ancient stone circles to living pilgrimage destinations, discover the places
                where heaven touches earth.
significance: A realm of golden halls and divine power at the top of Yggdrasil.

geography: Located at the top of Yggdrasil (World Tree); accessible via Bifrost rainbow bridge from Midgard. Contains golden halls (Valhalla for Odin, Bilskirnir for Thor, Folkvangr for Freyja); surrounded by great wall
relatedEvents: Ragnarok - the prophesied end of Asgard
Bifrost breaking under weight of Surtr during apocalypse
Asgardians' final stand against Frost Giants
